Comment: From the story:  SpaceX fans can expect to see a boom in activity out at Boca Chica after the Federal Aviation Administration on Tuesday granted the company permission to do as many as 25 launches and 50 landings per year at its Starbase facility.  The agency cited President Donald Trump’s revocation of a Carter-era environmental protection law as the impetus for the new increased launch approval.  With the revocation of Executive Order 11991, signed in May 1977 by then-President Jimmy Carter, the FAA ruled that allowing SpaceX to ramp up the number of launches from Starbase will not negatively affect the environment.  With the revocation of Executive Order 11991, signed in May 1977 by then-President Jimmy Carter, the FAA ruled that allowing SpaceX to ramp up the number of launches from Starbase will not negatively affect the environment.  “The FAA has determined that modifying SpaceX’s vehicle operator license supporting the increased launch and landing cadence of the Starship/Super Heavy launch vehicle would not significantly impact the quality of human environment within the meaning of NEPA,” the FAA stated in a [53-page summary of its decision](https://www.faa.gov/media/94336).  You can read more: [https://www.mysanantonio.com/news/south-texas/article/faa-spacex-starbase-starship-super-heavy-launches-20313559.php](https://www.mysanantonio.com/news/south-texas/article/faa-spacex-starbase-starship-super-heavy-launches-20313559.php)
